Description: Egyptian glazed composition (faience) 'Common bowl'; mould-made and covered with a blue glaze with brown painted decoration; hemispherical body, rounded rim and round base; interior decoration consists of a large rosette in the centre framed with encircling lines with dots; part of rim broken; mended from sherds.
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 and fig. 4b on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (no. 148, p. 56)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 36)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (M.4)
